<snip>

Thus spake J.B.:

>An IAE puts the focus on the calling code; a g=
eneric RE puts the focus
>on an external resource this class uses, like a d=
atabase or a network.
>You may wish, for whatever reason, to make that clea=
r in your code,
>possibly by extending IllegalArgumentException to a class =
that provides
>better information about what was illegal, when and from who=
m.

Yes! Always a good thing. I try to encourage team members to follow thi=
s advice whenever possible. I was taught this by a very wise programmer (th=
anks Geoff) and have tried to follow this path myself. The value that it ad=
ds to a system is much greater than the effort required to create the excep=
tion extra classes.

Simon
